Package games

Class Hangman

java.lang.Object
helpers.Game
games.Hangman
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class Hangman
extends Game
This is a single or two player Hangman program.

    • getCorrectlyGuessedLetters

      public char[] getCorrectlyGuessedLetters()
      Returns character array of letters that have already been guessed and appear in the guess word.
      Returns:
      the array of characters correctly guessed by the player(s)

    • getGuessWordProgress

      public java.lang.String getGuessWordProgress()
      Returns progress of guess word, with underscores indicating unguessed letters. Displays progress of guess word to player(s)

      Converts guesses to string format. Adds space after each letter in string for improved readability.

      Examples of guess word progress print statements are in the following table.

      Examples of print guess word progress statements
      Print Result Guess Word Letters Guessed Outstanding Letters
      d _ _ _ data d a,t
      p o l y m o r p h _ _ m polymorphism p,o,l,y,m,h i,s
      j a v a java j,v,a (none)
      b _ o _ k _ h _ i n blockchain b,o,k,h,i l,c,a
      Returns:
      progress of guess word in string format, with underscores indicating unguessed letters

    • checkIfGuessCorrect

      public void checkIfGuessCorrect​(java.lang.String guess)
      Determines whether guess is a correct guess.

      A correct guess can be a character that appears in the guess word, multiple characters separated by commas that appear in the guess word, or the entire guess word itself

      Parameters:
      guess - the player's current guess

    • assertCorrectGuess

      public void assertCorrectGuess​(char c)
      Assert whether a character guess is correct.

      If the guess is correct, correctGuess(char) is called. Else, incorrectGuess() is called.

      A character guess is considered correct if it appears in the guess word and has not already been guessed.

      Parameters:
      c - the character guessed

    • assertCorrectGuess

      public void assertCorrectGuess​(java.lang.String s)
      Assert whether a string guess is correct.

      If the guess is correct, correctGuess(String) is called. Else, incorrectGuess() is called.

      A character guess is considered correct if it is equal to the guess word, ignoring case.

      Parameters:
      s - the string guessed

    • characterInGuessWord

      public boolean characterInGuessWord​(char c)
      Returns whether a character guessed appears in the guess word.
      Parameters:
      c - the character guessed
      Returns:
      true if the character appears in guess word; false otherwise

    • guessNotInPreviousGuesses

      public boolean guessNotInPreviousGuesses​(char c)
      Returns whether a character guessed has already been guessed.
      Parameters:
      c - the character guessed
      Returns:
      true if character was not previously guessed; false otherwise

    • insertCorrectLetterGuess

      public void insertCorrectLetterGuess​(char c)
      Adds correctly guessed letter to character array of correctly guess letters.
      Parameters:
      c - the correctly guessed letter

    • hasPlayerWon

      public boolean hasPlayerWon()
      Returns whether the player(s) has/have won.

      A player or players win(s) if their current guess is equal to the guess word, ignoring case, or if the character array of correctly guessed letters in string form is equal to the guess word, ignoring case.

      Returns:
      true if player(s) has/have met win conditions; false otherwise

    • hasPlayerLost

      public boolean hasPlayerLost()
      Returns whether the player(s) has/have won.

      A player or players lose(s) if the number of incorrect guesses in the current round is equal to the number of allowed incorrect guesses.

      Returns:
      true if player(s) has/have lost; false otherwise

    • playerWin

      public void playerWin()
      Increments win streak by 1, increments number of rounds won by 1, prints win message, and adds 3 points to player's or players' score(s).

    • playerLoss

      public void playerLoss()
      Resets win streak, increments number of rounds lost by 1, and prints loss message.

    • roundFinish

      public void roundFinish()
      Finishes the round and runs playerWin or playerLoss method, depending on whether player(s) won or lost.

      Prints the guess word, increments the number of rounds played by 1, and prints round statistics.

    • newRound

      public void newRound()
      Starts a new round.

      Sets new random guess word, resets number of previous total, correct, and incorrect guesses and correctly guessedLetters, sets firstGame to false, indicating that this is at least the second game played, and starts a new round.

    • correctGuess

      public void correctGuess​(char guess)
      Indicates that a letter has been correctly guessed.

      Increments number of total and correct guesses by 1. Adds letter to correct letter guesses character array, and increments the player's or players' points by 1.

      Parameters:
      guess - the character guessed

    • correctGuess

      public void correctGuess​(java.lang.String guess)
      Indicates that the guess word has been correctly guessed.

      Increments number of total guesses and correct guesses by 1.

      Parameters:
      guess - the string guessed

    • incorrectGuess

      public void incorrectGuess()
      Indicates that a guess was incorrect.

      Increments number of total and incorrect guesses by 1.

    • printNumIncorrectGuessesRemaining

      public void printNumIncorrectGuessesRemaining()
      Prints to player(s) how many incorrect guesses remain.

    • printRoundStats

      public void printRoundStats()
      Prints round-specific statistics including points, current win streak, and the number of total, correct, and incorrect guesses.
